intro: Securidaca welwitschii, commonly known as the African senna, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces pods that contain seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in savannas and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
